summary: Gary T. Cornwell was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail his position and salary within the committee. The documents consistently list him as an employee during this period, indicating his involvement in the HSCA's activities related to the investigation of assassinations.
significance: Gary T. Cornwell's significance lies in his employment within the HSCA, contributing to the committee's investigation, although the specific nature and impact of his role are not detailed in these documents.
